Generation V.Black: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.
Generation V.White: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.
Generation V.Black 2: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
Generation V.White 2: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.

Generation VI.X: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
Generation VI.Y: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The leaf on Snivy’s tail generates energy when exposed to sunlight, making Snivy swifter and adding an edge to its moves.
Generation IX.Violet: It prefers to avoid groups. In its day-to-day life, it dexterously controls its vines to compensate for its short arms.

Generation V.Black: First partner Pokémon from Professor Juniper in Nuvema Town
Generation V.White: First partner Pokémon from Professor Juniper in Nuvema Town
Generation V.Black 2: First partner Pokémon from Bianca in Aspertia City
Generation V.White 2: First partner Pokémon from Bianca in Aspertia City

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after completing the Delta Episode
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after completing the Delta Episode

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Savanna Biome (after boosting biodiversity in the Savanna Biome)
